definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now

sentences.english: Your intellect is a better instrument of spiritual growth than any religious teachings.
sentences.chinese: 你的聰明才智是比宗教教義更好的心靈脩煉工具。

sentences.english: What's, like what's the most efficient use of people?
sentences.chinese: 怎麼樣才能最大限度地發揮他們的聰明才智？

sentences.english: Through man's spirit of ingenuity he has made himself obsolescent as a worker.
sentences.chinese: 人的聰明才智使他自己變成了過時落伍的工人。

sentences.english: Seeing as Mr Moreton is a doctor, I would assume he has a modicum of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 既然莫爾頓先生是位醫生，我想他應該有點聰明才智。

sentences.english: In 9, patience is all one's ability and cleverness foundation.
sentences.chinese: 耐心是一切迠聰明才智的基礎。

sentences.english: just to be out like, leagues ahead of everybody else in terms of like brain ability.
sentences.chinese: 就聰明才智來講，任何人都無法和他相比。

sentences.english: Man ususlly avoids attributing cleverness to somebody else, unless it's an enemy.
sentences.chinese: 人極少誇讚別人的聰明才智，除非那是你的敵人。

sentences.english: Her cleverness and talent helped her look more beautiful than ever.
sentences.chinese: 她的聰明才智使她更顯得美貌非凡。

sentences.english: In short, it is a master of national intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 總之，它是民族聰明才智的集大成者。

sentences.english: He is an incredibly intelligent musician.
sentences.chinese: 他是個極有聰明才智的音樂家。

sentences.english: Students must rely on their own intelligence to learn and to explore.
sentences.chinese: 學生們必須依靠自己的聰明才智去學習和探索新知。

sentences.english: While this may be generous, his on-field intelligence is off the charts.
sentences.chinese: 魯尼在球場上表現出來的聰明才智實在是太出色了。

sentences.english: And they are a real credit to their mother’s ingenuity and dedication.
sentences.chinese: 他們真的信任母親的聰明才智和奉獻精神。

definition: handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
lit. to devise battle plan in a tent (idiom)/fig. planning strategies
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
